means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯帕罗绰号，身材小而活泼的人，来源于中世纪英语及古英语，含义是“麻雀”(sparrow)

sentence.Network_en: Mr Sparrow has acted with commendable speed.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯帕罗先生行动之快值得赞扬。

sentence.Network_en: A sparrow may be small but it has all the vital organs.
The sparrow crossed the lawn in a series of hops.
sentence.Network_cn: 那麻雀一蹦一跳地穿过草坪.

entry.def: A sparrow is a small brown bird that is very common in Britain.

means.word_mean: 1. any of several small dull-colored singing birds feeding on seeds or insects

sentences.en: A sparrow alighted on the branch.
sentences.cn: 一只麻雀飞落在树枝上。

sentences.en: A sparrow is very alert in its movements.
I used to snare small birds such as sparrows.
sentences.cn: 我曾常用罗网捕捉麻雀等小鸟。

sentences.en: A sparrow may be small but it has all the vital organs.
Little sparrows fluttered among the branches.
sentences.cn: 小麻雀在枝条间飞来飞去。

sentences.en: There are many sparrows on the tree.
He flung a stone at the sparrows,he missed,scaring all the sparrows away.
sentences.cn: 他投石子打麻雀,没有击中,把麻雀都吓飞了。
